intro: Elionurus barbiculmis var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered elionurus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its foliage is generally lance-shaped with a rough texture, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
